title: Bug 116744 - Dynamic text content type has no effect
description: The dynamic text element's Content Type property does not have any effect on the report. It should display different results based on the selected content type, but it always displays the same results regardless of the selected content type.
OB: When I set the dynamic text element's Content Type property to Auto, Plain, or HTML, the report displays the same results.
EB:
I expect different results based on the selected content type:

- For Plain, I expect the literal content (tags and all) to be displayed.
- For Auto, I expect content 1, 2, and 3 to appear properly without HTML or RTF tags.
- For HTML, I expect content 1 and 2 to appear properly without HTML tags, and content 3 to appear literally with RTF tags.
SR:
1. Open the attached report.
2. Locate the dynamic text element.
3. Set the Content Type property to Auto.
4. Verify that the report displays the same results.
5. Repeat steps 3-4 with the Content Type property set to Plain.
6. Repeat steps 3-4 with the Content Type property set to HTML.
7. Observe that the report still displays the same results regardless of the selected content type.
